page.title: 09FARMING. (CONT. FROM PAGE 8)
page.content: The soil in this area varies from sandy to clay and from well drained to fenland. Bore holes are commonly used. Typical{CROP YIELDS}are as follows:- Wheat -------- 3.5 tons per acre. Barley ------- 2.5 tons per acre. Peas --------- 1.5 tons per acre. Beet -------- 18.0 tons per acre. (16-18% sugar content). There is some{REED CUTTING}in the fens and also tree planting elsewhere. {ANIMAL FARMING} 40 milking cows, 70 fattening cattle, 70 heifers and approx. 40 sows. Annual milk output about 30,000 gall. There is also some intensive pig and poultry farming in the area. A local fertiliser supplier provides a{SOIL TESTING}service for customers to determine the precise soil short- ages and type of fertiliser needed.
